entry.title: shortcuts: Offset debug shortcuts enum
entry.content:
This change sets an offset of 9000 to DEBUG actions

in the action enum list. This allows new non-DEBUG

actions to be added to bottom of ash actions instead of

below the existing DEBUG actions to avoid a potentially

confusing enum.



Update the relevant histogram enum to reflect the offset.



Bug: b/216049298

entry.title: Add a chrome activity type (browser app) to the SearchActivity.
entry.content:
SearchActivity (which provides the chrome search widget on Android) was not setting an activity type while active. As such, any UMA data recorded in association SearchActivity was annotated with the whatever activity type happened to be the last set in Chrome.



This CL updatest SearchActivity to explicitly manage its activity type and its uma session state as it resumes and pauses.



Bug: 1513485

entry.title: Reset scale of bad RCS tests
entry.content:
Legacy rgb color channels are in the range [0,255] while alpha is in

the range [0,1]. Therefore the color:

rgb(from red alpha 0 0)

has a red channel of 1/255, not 100% (or, 255 in this case).



Some tests need to be changed to reflect this.

entry.title: media: Fix bug related to UpgradeDatabaseSchema
entry.content:
The comment in the CL covers it pretty clearly, but to recap:



The CL upgrading the DatabaseSchema only set the meta_table's Version

Number and not CompatibleVersionNumber. This meant that the second and

onwards usage of the CdmStorageDatabase, a call to

UpgradeDatabaseSchema would be called in OpenDatabase() and would

fail, leading to no writes being allowed, since the SQL would fail as

we are trying to add a column that is already added.



This CL fixes this by fixing the underlying issue, adding a check so

that we can catch this and set the meta_table's version properly, and

adds a unittests to verify that closing and opening the database the

second time around still works as expected.



Bug: 1454512

Change-Id: Ie5a6f160f5b1c192888ed87b7a7069419dd663a3

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5206434

Auto-Submit: Vikram Pasupathy

Reviewed-by: John Rummell

Commit-Queue: Vikram Pasupathy

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1249012}

entry.title: Ensure that srcdoc documents do not inherit the wrong base URL.
entry.content:
The initiator's base URL should only be inherited if the initiator's

origin is also inherited.



Note that Chromium's current behavior is not spec-compliant, and allows

about:srcdoc navigations to inherit the wrong base URL. This CL

maintains the spec non-compliance in order to make a minimal change,

while fixing an associated security issue. Follow-up work in

https://crbug.com/1169736 will bring us into alignment with the spec by

disallowing about:srcdoc navigations in the cases that this CL affects,

altogether.



Bug: 1515381

Change-Id: Icb78224c7de58fe3f85b143c16bdb9a2ede4170e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5188098

entry.title: Revert "flags: don't rewrite generated expired list unnecessarily"
entry.content:
This reverts commit e303a4a62b466fcb9771f2f0490601ef0eed0fff.



Reason for revert: Suspected cause of build failures: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-archive-rel/109464/overview



Original change's description:

> flags: don't rewrite generated expired list unnecessarily

>

> If someone changes the milestone of an unexpired flag in the flag

> metadata file, or changes a comment or similar, the generated C++ file

> doesn't change, but the tool currently rewrites it anyway. This updates

> the mtime on it and causes a rebuild of the targets that depend on it.

>

> To avoid that, have the tool only rewrite the generated C++ file if

> there are actual changes to its contents.

>

> To test this:

> $ touch chrome/browser/flag-metadata.json

> $ ninja -v -C $OUTDIR chrome

>

> Before this change, you'll see several targets rebuilt; afterwards

> you'll just see this script running. You can also edit an expired flag

> to have a different expiry milestone and see that in that situation the

> script does still rewrite the file. I did not write an automated test

> for this behavior because it's annoying to write a portable, non-flaky

> test that messes with mtimes and such.

>

> Fixed: 1518423

> Change-Id: I057111cb55cb88b0eb17e09ea419e76fd178a5ac

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5213225

> Reviewed-by: Alexei Svitkine

> Commit-Queue: Alexei Svitkine

> Auto-Submit: Elly FJ

> Commit-Queue: Elly FJ

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248997}

correctly so needs to be deprecated.

entry.title: flags: don't rewrite generated expired list unnecessarily
entry.content:
If someone changes the milestone of an unexpired flag in the flag

metadata file, or changes a comment or similar, the generated C++ file

doesn't change, but the tool currently rewrites it anyway. This updates

the mtime on it and causes a rebuild of the targets that depend on it.



To avoid that, have the tool only rewrite the generated C++ file if

there are actual changes to its contents.



To test this:

$ touch chrome/browser/flag-metadata.json

$ ninja -v -C $OUTDIR chrome



Before this change, you'll see several targets rebuilt; afterwards

you'll just see this script running. You can also edit an expired flag

to have a different expiry milestone and see that in that situation the

script does still rewrite the file. I did not write an automated test

for this behavior because it's annoying to write a portable, non-flaky

test that messes with mtimes and such.



Fixed: 1518423

Change-Id: I057111cb55cb88b0eb17e09ea419e76fd178a5ac

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5213225

entry.title: CookieSettingsBase: Use SETTING_SOURCE_TPCD_GRANT for kAllowBy3PCDHeuristics
entry.content:
In the course of refactoring GetCookieSettingInternal() [0], I noticed

that ThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism::kAllowBy3PCDHeuristics did not map

to the same SettingSource as the other 3PCD-related values.



This CL maps kAllowBy3PCDHeuristics to SETTING_SOURCE_TPCD_GRANT, which

changes the behavior of the following methods:



* CookieSettingsBase::GetCookieSetting()

* CookieSettingsBase::GetThirdPartyCookieAllowMechanism()



Specifically, these methods may now return SETTING_SOURCE_TPCD_GRANT

where they used to return SETTING_SOURCE_NONE (implicitly, by not

changing the value of the SettingInfo::source field).



[0]: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5178770/comment/532c4bac_13a111a1/



R=alvingo@google.com

entry.title: [iOSKeyboardAccessoryUpgrade] Cosmetic changes for the new keyboard accessory
entry.content:
This Cl adds the ability to modify a few UI elements required for the

kIOSKeyboardAccessoryUpgrade feature. Now, the UI can conditionally:

- Add a manual fill button

- Remove the previous/next buttons

- Use an image instead of text for the close button

- Increase its height

- Change its background color



Note that this CL is a noop in terms of functionality unless the `kIOSKeyboardAccessoryUpgrade` feature is enabled. A new EG test was added to verify that this new UI still works properly. More tests will be added as more functionality gets implemented.



See go/ios-keyboard-accessory for details.

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Only show custom fonts on Read Aloud.
entry.content:
The WebUI toolbar without Read Aloud has a bug where

the font dropdown shows a scrollbar the first time the

dropdown is opened, which looks a little odd.



Removing the custom fonts on the toolbar itself (e.g.

"Poppins" on the dropdown is shown in the set font- not

in "Poppins").



This is current behavior on the Views toolbar, so this isn't

a regression.



Fixing this in the simplest way possible because I'm hesitant to

make too many changes to the menu structure this close to the

branch cut that could break things in a major way (such as the

accessibility of the menu itself.)



Original: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/7k57bwzAjmNVqhu.png

After this CL: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/9msw3FZiXQ2WfTE.png

entry.title: Revert "Android: Enable __ANDROID_UNAVAILABLE_SYMBOLS_ARE_WEAK__"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 7a58fcee02ffb8fe83cfa1a67a7cb445c26f2f01.



Reason for revert: Broke AudioAndroidOutputTest.StartOutputStreamCallbacks

on Android P



https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/test-analysis/b/5646442452484096



Original change's description:

> Android: Enable __ANDROID_UNAVAILABLE_SYMBOLS_ARE_WEAK__

>

> This simplifies calling functions that are introduced after our

> minSdkVersion.

>

> Adds two macros to make availability attributes less verbose:

> class REQUIRES_ANDROID_API(x)

> is short for:

> class __attribute__((__availability__(android, introduced = x)))

>

> #pragma clang attribute push DEFAULT_REQUIRES_ANDROID_API(29)

> is short for:

> #pragma clang attribute push(__attribute__((__availability__(android, introduced = x))), apply_to = any(enum, enum_constant, field, function, namespace, record, type_alias, variable))

>

> The new warnings (from -Wunguarded-availability) triggered in only two

> spots: aaudio_stream_wrapper.cc, and ndk_media_codec_wrapper.cc

>

> This commit converts these two files from explicit dlopen() / dlsym()

> to using weak symbols and availability attributes.

>

> See: https://android.googlesource.com/platform/ndk/+/master/docs/BuildSystemMaintainers.md#weak-symbols-for-api-definitions

>

> Bug: 1515372

> Change-Id: Ia0a79161456d1cbe1510d840187bf023e62a9be1

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5177627

entry.title: Simplify MetricsHandler::HandleRecordInHistogram
entry.content:
This CL simplifies MetricsHandler::HandleRecordInHistogram used in

WebUI.



Previously, this function had a custom method of generating a histogram

and deciding the histogram buckets. I found that to be not great,

because:

1) It was specific to WebUI.

2) In practice, the bucket dividing code was never used, because every

caller has a maximum of less than 100.



This CL converts it to follow the semantics of

base::UmaHistogramExactLinear. Every WebUI caller that I could find in

the codebase would have no problem with this:



https://source.chromium.org/search?q=metricsHandler:recordInHistogram%20-path:%5Egen%2F%20-path:%5Eout%2F



Bug: b/320773969

Change-Id: I697ea63e82e4a039e71905022e54e81118abb004

Commit-Queue: Tommy Li

entry.title: Fix extension content script executions not being sent to activity log
entry.content:
A code error in ScriptsRunInfo::LogRun results in the IPC for

ContentScriptsExecuting being sent when the render frame is nullptr

instead of when it's not nullptr.



In the majority of cases, the render frame is alive, so the bug has the

effect of the IPC not being sent when extensions execute scripts.

In the converse case, when the frame is nullptr (say, it was destroyed

by the script - a use case tested by the

BackForwardCacheDisabledDestructiveScriptTest suite, for example), the

result is an access violation.

I've verified that the tests in this suite fail when activity log

collection is enabled and pass with this fix.



Bug: 1519380

Change-Id: I9e7d4a0407d5789670921b3933ea4bfa819a4b99

entry.title: TaskAttribution: Refactor regexp script context and use for CPED
entry.content:
This is part of changing continuation preserved embedder data (CPED) to

be per-isolate instead of per-context. This CL:

- Change V8PerIsolateData::EnsureScriptRegexpScriptState() to return

ScriptState, which simplifies the rest.



- Adds V8PerIsolateData::

EnsureContinuationPreservedEmbedderDataScriptState(). This

returns the same ScriptState as the EnsureScriptRegexpScriptState()

to reduce overhead (implementation detail).



- Renames WorldType::kRegExp to kBlinkInternalNonJSExposed, which is

the type used for the shared CPED/RegExp context.



- Uses the internal non-js exposed utility context to set the CPED for

task attribution and scheduling APIs.



PERFETTO_TESTS=`autoninja -C out/Default perfetto_diff_tests && out/Default/bin/run_perfetto_diff_tests`

entry.title: Add qualifier `includeFor` to indicate interface inclusion scope
entry.content:
`includeFor` is an optional qualifier that indicates what scope the

interface and the specializations should be included for, when used in

conjunction with the optional `--generate_for` command line option.

`includeFor` is ignored if no `--generate_for` command line option is

specified. For instance:

* `"includeFor": ["system"]` will add the interface and the

specializations only when using the `--generate_for=system` command line

option, but not when using the `--generate_for=user` command line

option.

entry.title: Refactor CookieSettingsBase::GetCookieSettingInternal()
entry.content:
I found the original implementation difficult to reason about, I think

primarily due to not really understanding the `block_third` variable.

There's also some repetitive checking of conditions that are variations

on `block_third` and `IsAllowed(setting)`. I found these confusing

because `IsAllowed(setting)` is a part of the conjunction that defines

`block_third`'s original value! Finally, I found it difficult to reason

about whether the return value wants to allow or block cookies, since

it's defined in terms of variables, some of which may have been mutated

during the course of the function.



This CL addresses these sticking points by untangling the logic and

moving it into a helper function. The helper function is a sequence of

branches, each of which returns a clearly-labeled value. The helper

function returns absl::variant
BlockAllCookies>. The goal is that the reader can clearly see the intent

in lines like `return BlockAllCookies{};`.



Bug: 1519246

Change-Id: I2fc5206b3cfde78072e8d9f97eeae0e9c1d84921

entry.title: Compose: Debounce updating scrollable classes
entry.content:
A ResizeObserver observes any changes in height on the scrollable body

so that it can draw lines above/below it when it becomes scrollable.

This debounces that check so that the check doesn't happen as often.

This is useful for when animations cause the size to change with every

frame, which sometimes resulted in extra lines being drawn while

the size was still changing.



Before: http://screencast/cast/NTY2NDUzMDczMzQ2NTYwMHwzNGFjZmY5OS1hOQ

After: http://screencast/cast/NjIxOTYyNTEwNzgxNjQ0OHxiNGMyYmFlMS1mYw

(In the Before video, there's a line below the body that flickers.)

entry.title: [libc++] Add the <__assertion_handler> header
entry.content:
Because of https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/77883, libc++

headers now #include an __assertion_handler header file that is

either generated by CMake or provided by the vendor. Since we don't use

CMake for libc++, this CL vendors <__assertion_handler> by copying the

file default_assertion_handler.in [0], which is the file that CMake uses

to generate the default version of <__assertion_handler>.



This CL is needed to unblock the libc++ autoroller (since otherwise

libc++ won't compile due to the missing header).



[0]: https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/blob/main/libcxx/vendor/llvm/default_assertion_handler.in



Bug: 1517992

Change-Id: Ia551bdb706f7e68db914ddf46bf2128cdb1a6284

entry.title: [gpu] Remove some of unused texture_manager.h includes
entry.content:
Remove few texture_manager.h and other includes as identified in [1]

which analyzes include graph and identifies top includes and their

added sizes. When filtered on shared_image/ directory texture_manager.h

contributes quite a bit of size. This change removes it from some

files where it isn't really necessary.



Running compiler_inputs_size.py on before/after this change we get:

Before: 377,748,735,464 bytes

After: 377,710,848,487 bytes

thus reducing binary size by approx ~38MB



[1] https://commondatastorage.googleapis.com/chromium-browser-clang/include-analysis.html#view=edges

entry.title: SimpleCache: fix unwanted re-entry when size update...
entry.content:
...triggers entry doom and thus ends up running the operation queue in the wrong spot of creation (and entry op) completion handler. This can among other things result in this madness:



#6 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::CloseInternal()

#7 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::RunNextOperationIfNeeded()

#8 SimpleEntryImpl::ScopedOperationRunner::~ScopedOperationRunner()

#9 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::WriteDataInternal()

#10 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::RunNextOperationIfNeeded()

#11 SimpleEntryImpl::ScopedOperationRunner::~ScopedOperationRunner()

#12 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::WriteDataInternal()

#13 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::RunNextOperationIfNeeded()

#14 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::DoomEntry()

#15 disk_cache::SimpleBackendImpl::DoomEntryFromHash()

#16 disk_cache::SimpleBackendImpl::DoomEntries()

#17 disk_cache::SimpleIndex::StartEvictionIfNeeded()

#18 disk_cache::SimpleIndex::UpdateEntrySize()

#19 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::UpdateDataFromEntryStat()

#20 disk_cache::SimpleEntryImpl::CreationOperationComplete()

(namespace elided twice to avoid wrapping).



... which means we end up at the in_results = nullptr line near the bottom of CreationOperationComplete with null `synchronous_entry_`(!) (and a dangling in_results->sync_entry, where one would expect the two to be aliases). I *think* we won't actually deliver a callback from this state since we likely needed to be in optimistic path to got thus far, but I am not certain.



Similarly, when this sort of thing happens from within read/write ops, it could potentially cause callbacks to be delivered in wrong order if the queued op ends up being a stream 0 operation, which can be executed without a round trip to a worker thread.



Change-Id: Iac8058f0d18225677e361c6cdddf92d28fb4833f

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5054619

Reviewed-by: Adam Rice

Reviewed-by: Kenichi Ishibashi

Commit-Queue: Maks Orlovich

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1248862}

entry.title: [Hub] Remove erroneous asserts
entry.content:
When Hub is enabled these two on layout changed runnable already set

asserts are not valid. This is because if the Hub animation is

cancelled the associated runnable no longer needs to run and can be

dropped.



Because either a hide or show runnable will trigger when the animation

is cancelled we don't need to null out the runnables to avoid object

leaks.

entry.title: Parse privilege Group when config is read
entry.content:
A gnrt_config.toml may specify a 3p package's privilege group, in

accordance with our 3p security policies. This had been read into a

string field in CrateConfig, then parsed later.



The group field is changed to have type Option using new serde

impls for Group. ToString and the new_from_str methods were only used

for de/serialization, and serde handles this for enums itself so they

are removed.

entry.title: Add correctness tests for VideoFrameConverter.
entry.content:
This creates four color YUV and RGB frames, applies conversion,

and compares the resulting frames against the ideal version.



I considered just using white/black per the suggestion on the

previous change, but you could end up with passing values with

only the Y plane converted correctly.



For now I've just put the four color creation code inside the

test file, but it's likely other tests could benefit from

these functions in the future.



An alternative implementation would have been to only create the

RGB version of four colors, then use ConvertAndScale to create

the expected version. However, this felt too dependent on the

code under test to me (though both still use libyuv).



Bug: 1116617, 1116564, 1378115

Change-Id: I9a6e3f673245caf9c1d5f9bf164e51228b07a6c5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5208430

entry.title: Fix testing state leak.
entry.content:
ChromeShelfPrefs testing state is leaking to other tests,

and they're causing following tests to fails.

E.g.:

- ChromeShelfControllerLacrosOnlyTest.WithoutAppService

- ChromeShelfControllerWithArcTest.ArcAppsHiddenFromLaunchCanBePinned

- ChromeShelfControllerWithArcTest.ArcAppPinCrossPlatformWorkflow

in this order causes the second test to fail, and the third test to crash.



This CL properly unsets these testing state on their TearDown/dtor.



BUG=1494005

TEST=Tryjob. Run above tests.

entry.title: Revert^2 "Fix NOTREACHED in layoutTheme::DefaultSystemColor"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 4623524ac9f1d16f02cda02b0b9ee8d45a5dd78c.



Reason for revert: Addressed test flakes.



Tests started flaking after the original CL landed due to taking

screenshots too early. It is possible for a ref-test to take a

screenshot while still paint holding for first contentful paint.

A fix to prevent early screenshots landed in:



https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5160090.

entry.title: gif_recording: Account for the time needed to finalize recorded file
entry.content:
GIF may take a while to finalize the encoding and file saving after

the stop recording button is pressed and recording ends. Starting

a new recording in this transient state should not be allowed. The

file must be allowed to finalize first.



This CL adds `can_start_new_recording()` which must be checked to

see if it's possible to allow starting video recordings.



Fixed: b/319538388

Test: Manually, existing tests + modified tests.

Change-Id: I5c08dd313f455b7c3aef13f60140aeae49e8d976
